62#if !defined(SOCKPP_SOCKET_T_DEFINED)
63typedef int socket_t;
64const socket_t INVALID_SOCKET = -1;
65 #define SOCKPP_SOCKET_T_DEFINED
66#endif
67
73timeval to_timeval(const microseconds& dur);
74
80template <class Rep, class Period>
81timeval to_timeval(const duration<Rep, Period>& dur) {
82 return to_timeval(std::chrono::duration_cast<microseconds>(dur));
83}
84
90inline microseconds to_duration(const timeval& tv) {
91 auto dur = seconds{tv.tv_sec} + microseconds{tv.tv_usec};
92 return std::chrono::duration_cast<microseconds>(dur);
93}
94
100inline std::chrono::system_clock::time_point to_timepoint(const timeval& tv) {
101 return std::chrono::system_clock::time_point{
102 std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::system_clock::duration>(to_duration(tv))
103 };
104}
105
107// socket_initializer
109
120class socket_initializer
121{
123 socket_initializer();
124
125 socket_initializer(const socket_initializer&) = delete;
126 socket_initializer& operator=(const socket_initializer&) = delete;
127
128 friend class socket;
129
130public:
136 static void initialize() { static socket_initializer sock_init; }
140 ~socket_initializer();
141};
142
160void initialize();
161
163// socket
165
175class socket
176{
178 socket_t handle_{INVALID_SOCKET};
184 result<> close(socket_t h) noexcept;
185
186 // Non-copyable.
187 socket(const socket&) = delete;
188 socket& operator=(const socket&) = delete;
189
190protected:
197 template <typename T, typename Tout = T>
198 static result<Tout> check_res(T ret) {
199 return (ret < 0) ? result<Tout>::from_last_error() : result<Tout>{Tout(ret)};
200 }
207 template <typename T>
208 static result<> check_res_none(T ret) {
209 return (ret < 0) ? result<>::from_last_error() : result<>{none{}};
210 }
211
218 static result<socket_t> check_socket(socket_t s) {
219 return (s == INVALID_SOCKET) ? result<socket_t>::from_last_error()
220 : result<socket_t>{s};
221 }
222
223// For non-Windows systems, routines to manipulate flags on the socket
224// handle.
225#if !defined(_WIN32)
227 result<int> get_flags() const;
229 result<> set_flags(int flags);
231 result<> set_flag(int flag, bool on = true);
232#endif
233
234public:
236 using socket_pair = std::tuple<socket, socket>;
240 socket() = default;
247 explicit socket(socket_t h) noexcept : handle_{h} {}
253 socket(socket&& sock) noexcept : handle_{sock.handle_} { sock.handle_ = INVALID_SOCKET; }
257 virtual ~socket() { close(); }
272 static result<socket_t> create_handle(int domain, int type, int protocol = 0) noexcept {
273 return check_socket(socket_t(::socket(domain, type, protocol)));
274 }
292 static result<socket> create(int domain, int type, int protocol = 0) noexcept;
297 bool is_open() const { return handle_ != INVALID_SOCKET; }
303 bool operator!() const { return handle_ == INVALID_SOCKET; }
309 explicit operator bool() const { return handle_ != INVALID_SOCKET; }
314 socket_t handle() const { return handle_; }
321 virtual sa_family_t family() const { return address().family(); }
333 socket clone() const;
354 static result<socket_pair> pair(int domain, int type, int protocol = 0) noexcept;
359 socket_t release() noexcept {
360 socket_t h = handle_;
361 handle_ = INVALID_SOCKET;
362 return h;
363 }
368 void reset(socket_t h = INVALID_SOCKET) noexcept;
375 socket& operator=(socket&& sock) noexcept {
376 // Give our handle to the other to close.
377 std::swap(handle_, sock.handle_);
378 return *this;
379 }
388 result<> bind(const sock_address& addr, int reuse = 0) noexcept;
393 sock_address_any address() const;
398 sock_address_any peer_address() const;
414 result<> get_option(int level, int optname, void* optval, socklen_t* optlen)
415 const noexcept;
425 template <typename T>
426 result<> get_option(int level, int optname, T* val) const noexcept {
427 socklen_t len = sizeof(T);
428 return get_option(level, optname, (void*)val, &len);
429 }
438 template <typename T>
439 result<T> get_option(int level, int optname) const noexcept {
440 T val{};
441 auto res = get_option(level, optname, &val);
442 return (res) ? result<T>{val} : result<T>{res.error()};
443 }
452 result<bool> get_option(int level, int optname) const noexcept {
453 int val{};
454 auto res = get_option(level, optname, &val);
455 return (res) ? result<bool>{val != 0} : result<bool>{res.error()};
456 }
471 result<> set_option(
472 int level, int optname, const void* optval, socklen_t optlen
473 ) noexcept;
485 template <typename T>
486 result<> set_option(int level, int optname, const T& val) noexcept {
487 return set_option(level, optname, &val, sizeof(T));
488 }
499 result<> set_option(int level, int optname, const bool& val) noexcept {
500 return set_option(level, optname, int(val));
501 }
502
503 // ----- Specific socket options -----
504
513 virtual result<> set_non_blocking(bool on = true);
514
515#if !defined(_WIN32)
519 virtual bool is_non_blocking() const;
520#endif
526 result<bool> reuse_address() const noexcept {
527 return get_option<bool>(SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR);
528 }
534 result<> reuse_address(bool on) noexcept {
535 return set_option(SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, on);
536 }
537#if !defined(_WIN32) && !defined(__CYGWIN__)
543 result<bool> reuse_port() const noexcept {
544 return get_option<bool>(SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEPORT);
545 }
551 result<> reuse_port(bool on) noexcept { return set_option(SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEPORT, on); }
552#endif
558 result<unsigned int> recv_buffer_size() const noexcept {
559 return get_option<unsigned int>(SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF);
560 }
567 result<> recv_buffer_size(unsigned int sz) noexcept {
568 return set_option<unsigned int>(SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, sz);
569 }
575 result<unsigned int> send_buffer_size() const noexcept {
576 return get_option<unsigned int>(SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF);
577 }
584 result<> send_buffer_size(unsigned int sz) noexcept {
585 return set_option<unsigned int>(SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, sz);
586 }
595 result<> shutdown(int how = SHUT_RDWR);
602 virtual result<> close();
603
604 // ----- I/O -----
605
615 result<size_t> send_to(const void* buf, size_t n, int flags, const sock_address& addr) {
616#if defined(_WIN32)
617 auto cbuf = reinterpret_cast<const char*>(buf);
618 return check_res<size_t>(
619 ::sendto(handle(), cbuf, int(n), flags, addr.sockaddr_ptr(), addr.size())
620 );
621#else
622 return check_res<ssize_t, size_t>(
623 ::sendto(handle(), buf, n, flags, addr.sockaddr_ptr(), addr.size())
624 );
625#endif
626 }
634 result<size_t> send_to(const void* buf, size_t n, const sock_address& addr) {
635 return send_to(buf, n, 0, addr);
636 }
643 result<size_t> send_to(const string& s, const sock_address& addr) {
644 return send_to(s.data(), s.length(), 0, addr);
645 }
654 result<size_t> send(const void* buf, size_t n, int flags = 0) {
655#if defined(_WIN32)
656 return check_res<ssize_t, size_t>(
657 ::send(handle(), reinterpret_cast<const char*>(buf), int(n), flags)
658 );
659#else
660 return check_res<ssize_t, size_t>(::send(handle(), buf, n, flags));
661#endif
662 }
670 result<size_t> send(const string& s, int flags = 0) {
671 return send(s.data(), s.length(), flags);
672 }
682 result<size_t> recv_from(void* buf, size_t n, int flags, sock_address* srcAddr = nullptr);
691 result<size_t> recv_from(void* buf, size_t n, sock_address* srcAddr = nullptr) {
692 return recv_from(buf, n, 0, srcAddr);
693 }
701 result<size_t> recv(void* buf, size_t n, int flags = 0) {
702#if defined(_WIN32)
703 return check_res<ssize_t, size_t>(
704 ::recv(handle(), reinterpret_cast<char*>(buf), int(n), flags)
705 );
706#else
707 return check_res<ssize_t, size_t>(::recv(handle(), buf, n, flags));
708#endif
709 }
710};
711
713} // namespace sockpp
714
715#endif // __sockpp_socket_h
